name: "Steamed Eggs"
cook_method: "Cooking Method: Wash the eggs and place them in the egg steamer. Add an appropriate amount of water to the water level line of the steamer based on the number of eggs you want to steam. Cover the steamer, connect the power, and start steaming. Wait for the steamer to finish its work; generally, let it sit for a while after the indicator light goes off. Be careful of steam burns when opening the lid. After steaming, remove the eggs, and mix 1 to 2 grams of salt, 3 to 5 drops of dark soy sauce, and 2 to 3 drops of sesame oil in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the eggs, then sprinkle with 1 to 2 grams of chopped cilantro and green onions."

name: "Carrot Soy Milk"
cook_method: "Cooking Method: Wash and cut the carrots into pieces. Put the soybeans and carrot pieces into the soy milk maker, add an appropriate amount of water, and start the soy milk maker to blend into soy milk. After the soy milk is ready, you can add sugar to taste according to personal preference."

name: "Minced Pork with Steamed Eggplant"
cook_method: "Cooking Method: Peel and cut the purple-skinned eggplant into pieces. Slice ginger, green chili, and red chili for later use. Clean the pork and cut it into small pieces. Heat a pan with peanut oil, add ginger, onion, green chili, and red chili. Stir-fry the pork until the moisture evaporates, then remove it and place it over the eggplant as a base. Add oyster sauce, soy sauce, bean paste, and an appropriate amount of water to soak the eggplant. Cover the pot and simmer for 25 minutes, then add salt. If you prefer a softer texture, simmer for 30 minutes. Taste before serving, and if the flavor is right, you can serve it directly on a plate!"
